cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the butterfly egg stage as its first stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a process or life cycle includes a specific stage as a constituent phase.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the larval (caterpillar) stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle concept includes a specific life-cycle stage as one of its constituent phases.
remarks: Order relative to egg stage captured in separate relation.
Order relative to egg stage captured in separate relation.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the pupal (chrysalis) stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle concept includes a specific life-cycle stage as one of its constituent phases.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after larval stage, before adult stage

remarks: Order relative to larval and adult stages captured separately.
Order relative to larval and adult stages captured separately.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes an egg stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a process or life cycle includes a specific stage as a constituent phase.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: first in sequence before larval stage

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle concept includes a specific life-cycle stage as one of its constituent phases.
args.justification: All four relations link 'butterfly life cycle' to specific life-cycle stages, so they share the same predicate semantics. Two already use 'has_life_cycle_stage' with rel_cls 'life_cycle_stage_relation', while these two use the more generic 'has_stage' and 'process_stage_relation'. Normalizing them to the life-cycle-specific predicate and class improves schema consistency without changing meaning.
args.remark: Aligned generic 'has_stage' / 'process_stage_relation' entries with the more specific life cycle predicate and class used in the other instances.

Two already use 'has_life_cycle_stage' with rel_cls 'life_cycle_stage_relation', while these two use the more generic 'has_stage' and 'process_stage_relation'. Normalizing them to the life-cycle-specific predicate and class improves schema consistency without changing meaning.
executed_decisions.remark: Aligned generic 'has_stage' / 'process_stage_relation' entries with the more specific life cycle predicate and class used in the other instances.
